original_table_html:
Official Sponsors Event Sponsors
BFGoodrich—BFGoodrich’s national marketing efforts included television spots, print collateral, digital advertising, on-site activations, and competition course signage.

Ford—Ford’s national marketing efforts included television spots, print collateral, digital advertising, on-site activations, and competition course signage.

America’s Navy—Navy’s national marketing efforts included television spots, print collateral, digital advertising, radio campaigns, on-site activations, and competition course signage

Red Bull—Red Bull’s national marketing efforts included television spots, print collateral, digital ad space, on-site activations, and unique competition course signage. 		Casio G’zOne Commando—Casio’s national marketing efforts included television spots, online advertising, on-site activations, and competition course signage.

Shark Week—Discovery’s national marketing efforts included television spots, print collateral, online advertising, on-site activations, and competition course signage.

Mobil 1—Mobil 1’s national marketing efforts included television spots, online advertising, radio campaigns, and competition course signage.

Sony—Sony’s national marketing efforts included television spots, online advertising, on-site TV displays, and competition course signage.
summary_markdown: This data outlines the marketing efforts of two tiers of sponsors: Official Sponsors and Event Sponsors. The Official Sponsors, including BFGoodrich, Ford, America's Navy, and Red Bull, each engaged in a comprehensive suite of national marketing activities. These typically encompassed television spots, print collateral, digital advertising, on-site activations, and competition course signage, with some variations like radio campaigns for America's Navy and unique signage for Red Bull. The Event Sponsors, comprising Casio G’zOne Commando, Shark Week, Mobil 1, and Sony, also utilized national marketing strategies, though with slightly less breadth. Their efforts commonly included television spots, online advertising, on-site activations, and competition course signage, with specific inclusions like print collateral for Shark Week, radio campaigns for Mobil 1, and on-site TV displays for Sony. The structure highlights a tiered sponsorship model with distinct levels of marketing engagement.
